definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: This morning, the Japanese attacked Midway Island.
sentences.chinese: 今晨日本人襲擊了中途島。

sentences.english: And this morning, the Japanese attacked Midway Island.
sentences.chinese: 今晨，日本人進攻了中途島。

sentences.english: Each departure from Midway made him think long dark thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 他每次離開中途島時，都會陷入長時間陰鬱的冥想。

sentences.english: Our trip takes Midway as a starting point.
sentences.chinese: 我們的旅行以中途島爲起點。

sentences.english: And this morning, the Japanese attacked Midway island. Japan has therefore undertaken a surprise offensive extending throughout the Pacific area.
sentences.chinese: 今晨日本人襲擊了中途島。

sentences.english: The moray left midway in a melancholy drizzle .
sentences.chinese: “海鰻號”在陰沉沉的細雨中離開了中途島。

sentences.english: 1867 - The United States takes control of Midway Island.
sentences.chinese: 1867年的今天，美國控制了中途島。

sentences.english: Last night the Japanese attacked Wake Island.
sentences.chinese: 今晨日本軍隊進攻了中途島。

definition: General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war
Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4 Wei3 yuan2 hui4

definition: amphibious/dual-talented/able to work in two different lines
Jawaharlal Nehru (1889-1964), Indian politician, first prime minister 1947-1964

pinyin: Xiang1 gang3 Hong2 Shi2 zi4 hui4
